alert.note: Alert for Moffat; Rio Blanco (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 08 at 5:43PM MST until February 08 at 6:30PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... South central Moffat County in northwestern Colorado... Northwestern Rio Blanco County in northwestern Colorado... * Until 630 PM MST. * At 543 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Meeker to 14 miles northeast of Rangely, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 24 and 31. Colorado 13 between mile markers 37 and 56. Colorado 64 between mile markers 31 and 73. Locations impacted include... Meeker and Massadona. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
